result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason E Block was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $443 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $543 (includes DNA) within 60 days; non-payment results in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

To commence 11/6/15 by 7:00 pm
--With Huber/Work-Release privileges for purposes of employment & child care

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

--To submit a DNA Sample

Court orders that all conditions of bond remain in effect until commencement of jail terms

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason E Block

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended Time To Pay/ Payment Extension Reminder
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
from non-parties re: in support of Def. - submitted at plea/sentencing
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 10:11 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Jason E Block in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the word "violent" from the charging language from Count #2
Atty Witt confirms that Mr. Block is refusing probation, presents basis

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for purposes of employment & child care; to commence 11/6/15 by 7:00 pm 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $443 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $543 (includes DNA) within 60 days; non-payment results in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To submit a DNA Sample
Court orders that all conditions of bond remain in effect until commencement of jail terms
Recess: 10:32 am
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery

Prior: 1123 Harriette St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 11:13am. 
Attorney Michael C. Witt in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Witt indicates Defendant Jason Block is in the process of finding housing. The address on the Criminal Complaint is currently correct for mailings, however Attorney Witt will provide Mr. Block's new address by the end of this week.  

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Defense stands mute.  Pleas of "not guilty" are entered by the Court on behalf of the Defendant. 
Speedy trial rights are waived by the Defense.

The Court requires $200 Cash Bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Ryann Bixler or with their two children 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to report to the Clerk of Courts Office by 4:00pm on Friday 9/4/15 to sign this Amended Bond

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.  Attorney Witt indicates that he intends to file a Request for Substitution. 
recess 11:16am.


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/23/15 at 9:40am   (2)  Status Conference on 10/27/15 at 10:00am
Defendant's Demand & Motion for Discovery & Inspection
